name: ArtemisMissionCS
title: Artemis Missions
description: Historical and planned Artemis program missions with target destinations, launch dates, and status

concept.definition: Uncrewed test flight of Orion and SLS around the Moon. Launched Nov 16, 2022. Status: completed. Target: Lunar orbit and return.

designation.value: Status: completed | Target: Lunar orbit and return (uncrewed test) | Launch: 2022-11-16

concept.definition: First crewed lunar flyby mission of Artemis program. Planned ~2026. Status: planned. Target: Lunar flyby (crewed).

designation.value: Status: planned | Target: Lunar flyby (crewed) | Launch: ~2026

concept.definition: First crewed lunar landing of Artemis program at south pole. Planned ~2027. Status: planned. Target: Lunar south pole landing.

designation.value: Status: planned | Target: Lunar south pole landing | Launch: ~2027

concept.definition: Lunar Gateway assembly mission with landing. Planned ~2028. Status: planned. Target: Gateway assembly + landing.

designation.value: Status: planned | Target: Lunar Gateway assembly + landing | Launch: ~2028

concept.definition: Lunar landing with new lander and Lunar Terrain Vehicle. Planned ~2030. Status: planned. Target: Lunar landing (new lander, LTV rover).

designation.value: Status: planned | Target: Lunar landing (new lander, LTV rover) | Launch: ~2030

property.description: Launch date of mission (actual or planned)

name: ArtemisLandingRegionCS
title: Artemis Landing Regions
description: Candidate Artemis III landing regions near the lunar south pole (within 6° of pole, near permanently shadowed craters)

concept.definition: Rim of Faustini crater (~87°S, 84°E)
High point near Shackleton crater, south pole (~89°S, 126°E)
Ridge connecting crater rims in Shackleton–de Gerlache area (~89.5°S, 210°E)

property.valueString: Ridge between Shackleton and de Gerlache

concept.definition: Extension of Connecting Ridge (~89.3°S, 210°E)
One site on rim of de Gerlache crater (~88.5°S, 270°E)
Another site on rim of de Gerlache crater (~88.8°S, 250°E)
Massif between de Gerlache and Kocher craters (~85°S, 236°E)
Vicinity of Haworth crater floor/rim (~86.9°S, 356°E)
Malapert Mountain, high elevation near pole (~86°S, 0°E)
Elevated plateau in Mons Mouton area (~85.4°S, 32°E)
Rim of Nobile crater, site 1 (~85.7°S, 45°E)
Rim of Nobile crater, site 2 (~84.2°S, 60.7°E)
Rim of Amundsen crater (~84.5°S, 83°E)

property.description: Primary topographic feature (crater, massif, plateau, ridge)

name: ArtemisCertifiedDevicesCS
title: Artemis Certified Devices
description: Flight-qualified hardware and systems used in Artemis missions (Orion, xEMU, Starship-HLS, Gateway, LTV, etc.)

concept.definition: Orion Crew Module and Service Module (CM/SM) - spacecraft carrying crew to lunar orbit. Manufacturer: Lockheed Martin/NASA.
Space Launch System rocket - heavy-lift launch vehicle for Artemis missions. Manufacturer: Boeing/NASA.
Exploration Extravehicular Mobility Unit - next-generation spacesuit for lunar surface EVAs. Manufacturer: Axiom Space/Collins Aerospace.
SpaceX Starship variant serving as lunar lander for Artemis III. Manufacturer: SpaceX.
Unpressurized rover for surface mobility (Artemis V and later). Manufacturer: TBD.
Habitation and Logistics Outpost module of Lunar Gateway (primary habitat). Manufacturer: Northrop Grumman.
Power and Propulsion Element module of Lunar Gateway. Manufacturer: Maxar Technologies.
Planned future lunar base living quarters on surface. Manufacturer: TBD.
Lunar communication network elements (relay satellites or surface comm devices). Manufacturer: NASA/Partners.
Artemis mission medical equipment set (emergency medical pack, diagnostics). Manufacturer: NASA.
PLSS backpack for xEMU suit (life support during EVA). Manufacturer: Collins Aerospace.

property.description: Device category (spacecraft, suit, vehicle, habitat, equipment)

name: ArtemisPrototypeDevicesCS
title: Artemis Prototype Devices
description: Developmental and test hardware not yet flight-certified (demo units, ground analogs, next-gen prototypes)

concept.definition: Prototype EVA suit used in ground testing or ISS demonstration (not flight-certified). Test env: ground.
Early concept lunar pressurized rover (testing life support and habitat functions on Earth). Test env: ground.
Ground-based habitat prototype (e.g., 3D-printed habitat analog or Lunar/Mars yard modules). Test env: analog-mission.
Next-generation Portable Life Support System under development (for suits beyond Artemis). Test env: ground.
Experimental biomedical monitoring device (advanced smart garment for astronauts in trial). Test env: ISS.
Prototype diagnostic device or smart medical assistant being evaluated for lunar use. Test env: ground.

property.description: Device category (spacecraft, suit, vehicle, habitat, equipment)
